name: Greentown Labs
tag_list: cleantech, cleanweb, energy, alternative-energy, renewables, efficiency, solar, wind, storage, smart-grid, incubator, accelerator, non-profit, boston
overview:
Incubator space is great for web start-ups, but clean technology ventures require places for entrepreneurs to get dirty, bend metal, and make noise. Greentown Labs provides budding entrepreneurs access to the facility, services, and research & development resources needed to take their clean technology ventures to the next level.

Strategically positioned in Boston’s newly titled Innovation District, Greentown Labs provides a convenient and easily accessible address for its resident companies – 3.5 blocks from South Station, on a high‐visibility street, and less than 1.5 blocks from the Boston Convention and Exhibition Center.

Greentown Labs sprung from a grassroots cluster start-ups seeking low-cost clean energy protyping space near MIT in the summer of 2010. The resulting collaboration between companies proved so successful that in 2011 the founders decided to expand into a full-blown incubator space for clean technology start-ups.

Greentown Labs opened in May 2011 and is operated as a non-profit by directors from its resident companies. Their 14,000 square foot facility currently provides a home for (13) start-up companies.
